chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Weber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Dodge Correctional as reception center.  Concurrent with 13CF88.
Concurrent with: 13CF88

Defendant is required to register as a sex offender.  As such, he cannot work with children.  This penalty has been explained to the Defendant by the Court.

Submit DNA sample.

Pay costs including the DNA surcharge and the $500 child porn image surcharge.

Engage in, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming directed by the agent. 

Sentences in 13CF88 and 14CF66 are concurrent with each other with 90 days credit ordered for each of these concurrent cases.
Concurrent with: 13CF88

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. Weber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: via phone from Attorney Lawrence to convert case to eFile
Agent's note to clerk to amend the JOC and clerk's response to agent - clerk notes information contains the charge as contained in the minutes and JOC
Plea & Sentencing Hearing Held this 15th Day of October, 2014
request for documents received (docs sent 12/19 via mail)
1 document provided for 2 cases - filed and scanned into 13CF88

Appearances:  DA Harper, Def in custody and with Atty. Lawrence; Crawford County, KS District Attorney Michael Gayoso appearing by phone.

DA Harper states that there will be resolution of 3 cases in Richland County today:  13CF88, 14CF30 and 14CF66.  Harper details the agreement for the record:

13CF88 - def to plead GNC to count 1/poss. child porn; counts 2 and 3 to be dismissed/read in for 3 years initial confinement with 3 years ext. supervision with $500 per count surcharge (image surcharge) plus DNA, costs, firearm warnings, asst/treatment at direction of agent

14CF66 - complaint was filed yesterday so initial appearance and waiver of prelim needed, along with filing of information, charges include 1 ct possession child porn; def to plead GNC to count 1/poss. child porn for 3 years initial confinement, 7 years ext. supervision with same conditions as in the other matter; those 2 cases to run concurrent with each other

DA Harper - the intention of this proposed resolution is for def to spend 3 years confinement and then be on ext. supervision for next 7 years.  14CF30/extradition case to be dismissed.  Also, 14CR115P/Kansas case to be dismissed with prejudice.

Clarification re $500 per image surcharge:  counsel state that the surcharge agreed to will be $500 two times - one surcharge for each count pled to.

In 13CF88, Court conducts waiver of prelim colloquy.  In 14CF66, Court conducts initial appearance.  Formal reading waived.  Prelim colloquy conducted.  Court orders bindover in both cases.

13CF88, Def pleads no contest to count 1.  14CF66, Def pleads no contest to count 1.  Court's colloquy re pleas.  Finding of guilty to both counts/cases.  Counsel address the Court.  Atty. L states def should have 90 days credit.  No objection from the State.

Sentence:  Court adopts the jt recommendation for sentencing and orders as follows - counts 2 and 3 dismissed/read in in 13CF88 case.  Sentence - 6 year prison sentence with 3 years in and 3 years e.s. with Dodge as reception center.  14CF66 - total 10 year sentence with 3 years initial confinement and 7 years e.s., concurrent with 13CF88.  $500 image surcharge imposed in both case.  Requirement of def to register as sex offender.  As registered s.o., cannot work with children; penalty explained if def violates that.  Pay costs including DNA surcharge.  Submit sample of DNA.  Engage in, pay for, succ. complete any treatment or programs directed by agent.  90 days credit on each sentence as they are concurrent with each other.  As a convicted felon, Court provides firearm admonishment - no firearms for lifetime; penalties explained.  Voting rights suspended during period of the sentence with restoration after sentence completion.

14CR115P dismissed.
